answers.answer: Hi,One differential for this is a boil.Boils may start as a small reddish bump that may rapidly grow in size.This eventually becomes tender,ruptures and drains thick yellowish pus.Boils are caused by staphylcoccal organisms that invade the skin through small cuts or wounds.You may require oral antibiotics for this.Consult your physician regarding this. Avoid unnecessarily manipulating or touching the area.Also,do you have other underlying disease like diabetes?Keep the area dry and clean.You may take pain relievers for the pain.
